keyTakeAways: Colombia has recalled its ambassador to the United States, Daniel García-Peña, for consultations, in response to U.S. actions related to drug trafficking and alleged attacks on Colombian vessels.
This is the second such diplomatic move in Colombia this year, following a prior recall in July after U.S. actions tied to claims of political plots against President Gustavo Petro.
U.S. President Donald Trump accused President Petro of being an 'illegal drug leader' and threatened to cut subsidies and raise tariffs on Colombian exports, intensifying the diplomatic standoff.

The United States has deployed warships in the Caribbean and launched missile strikes on seven suspected drug-smuggling vessels, resulting in at least 30 deaths, including some reportedly Colombian citizens.
President Petro accused the U.S. of 'murder' and claimed that some individuals on the vessels were Colombians, which contributed to the diplomatic rupture.
A Colombian citizen on the latest vessel attacked was returned safely to Colombia, highlighting the human cost and emotional dimension of the conflict.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Colombia has recalled its ambassador to the United States, Daniel García-Peña, for consultations, escalating diplomatic tensions over U.S. military actions targeting suspected drug-smuggling vessels in the Caribbean. This marks the second such action in Colombia this year, following a similar move in July. President Gustavo Petro of Colombia accused the U.S. of supporting a political plot against him and claimed that some individuals aboard the vessels were Colombian citizens, accusing the United States of 'murder.' U.S. President Donald Trump criticized Petro as an 'illegal drug leader,' threatened to end subsidies and raise tariffs on Colombian exports, and authorized missile strikes that have killed at least 30 people, including some believed to be Colombian nationals. A Colombian citizen aboard the latest vessel was returned safely to Colombia, underscoring the human toll and emotional stakes of the conflict.
